intro: Aphanamixis coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved aphanamixis, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a distinctive rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Aphanamixis coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in tropical forests.
